articles.title: Analysts Detail Claims That Reports on ISIS Were Distorted
articles.excerpt: The Pentagon’s inspector general is examining claims that senior military officers manipulated conclusions about progress against the Islamic State.

articles.title: As Shutdown Nears, Obama to Join Budget Fight
articles.excerpt: As Republicans threaten to block a budget deal if it includes financing for Planned Parenthood, President Obama plans to push them to scrap a tax advantage for private equity managers.

articles.title: Obama Weighing Talks With Putin on Syrian Crisis
articles.excerpt: President Obama’s administration is debating whether the two leaders should try to work out their differences. Some fear a meeting would only play into Mr. Putin’s hands.

articles.title: Closing the Back Door to Europe
articles.excerpt: In recent months European nations have worked to block the main route taken by migrants fleeing war and upheaval.

articles.title: Attitudes Shift on Paid Leave: Dads Sue, Too
articles.excerpt: More men are filing lawsuits about taking time off work when a baby is born and facing setbacks when they return.

articles.title: Julianne Moore, Beauty and a Beast
articles.excerpt: Offscreen, she insists on normality. Onscreen, she lets the monster out.

articles.title: The March Toward Moral Clarity
articles.excerpt: Whether or not reform actually follows from Pope Francis’s advocacy, he is pointing to a hopeful future.

articles.title: The Imam’s Curse
articles.excerpt: A family accused of financing terrorists.

articles.title: Five Things Jeremy Corbyn Has Right
articles.excerpt: Whether he can translate his radical beliefs into effective leadership is a fair question to pose.

articles.title: Bringing the Refugee Crisis Home
articles.excerpt: Many Berliners are part of a growing cultural movement, influenced by simple humanism and an awareness of Germany’s own past.
